# 群論基礎 {#sec-group_theory}


## $S_3$群 {#sec-S3}

$S_3$は，3次の対称群で，正三角形の合同群である．
正三角形の合同群の元は$120^\circ$回転$\sthreer$, $240^\circ$回転$\sthreer^2 = \sthreer^{-1}$, 及び，各頂点を通る軸の反転$s_i$($i=1,2,3$)の$6$つからなる．
置換群との対応は，
\begin{align}
&e=\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3  \\
1 & 2 & 3 
\end{pmatrix}=(),\quad
\sthreer=\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3  \\
2 & 3 & 1 
\end{pmatrix}=(123),\quad
\sthreerr=\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3  \\
3 & 1 & 2 
\end{pmatrix}=(132),\notag\\
&\sthreera=\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3  \\
1 & 3 & 2 
\end{pmatrix}=(23),\quad
\sthreerb=\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3  \\
3 & 2 & 1
\end{pmatrix}=(13),\quad
\sthreerc=\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3  \\
2 & 1 & 3 
\end{pmatrix}=(12)
\end{align}
である．%$\sthreerc \sthreer \sthreerc=\sthreerr$.
元の合成は，例えば $\sthreerc\sthreer = \sthreera$や$\sthreerc\sthreerr = \sthreerb$のようになる．他の積は表\ref{table:S3}にまとめてある．

    $e$ &  $e$& $\sthreer$ & $\sthreerr$  & $\sthreera$ & $\sthreerb$ & $\sthreerc$   \\ \hline

中心化群 ($\mathrm{C}_{S_3}(s) = \{g\in G| sg=gs \text{ for all } s\in G \}$) of the representative of a conjugacy class are
\begin{align}
\mathrm{C}_{S_3}(\mathcal{C}_1) &= \mathrm{S}_3,\\
\mathrm{C}_{S_3}(\mathcal{C}_2) &= \{e,\sthreera\},\\
\mathrm{C}_{S_3}(\mathcal{C}_3) &= \{e,\sthreer,\sthreerr\}=\mathbb{Z}_3.
\end{align}

\begin{align*}
\rho_{A_1} &\equiv \rho^{(1)} \quad\text{(trivial)} \\
\rho_{A_2} &\equiv \rho^{(1')} \quad\text{(sign)} \\
\rho_E     &\equiv \rho^{(2)} \quad\text{(standard)}
\end{align*}

We define the class operators as $T_i = \sum_{g \in \mathcal{C}_i} g$. 
The products of these operators give the fusion rules of the conjugacy classes.

$\mathrm{S}_3$ has three unitary representations. These are two one-dimensional representations (the trivial representation $A_1$ and the $A_2$ representation) and one two-dimensional representation $E$. Specifically, $A_1$ is trivial for all $g \in \mathrm{S}_3$, i.e., $D_{A_1}(g) = 1$. For $A_2$, we have $D_{A_2}(g) = 1$ for $g \in \{e, \sthreer, \sthreerr\}$, and $D_{A_2}(g) = -1$ for $g \in \{\sthreera, \sthreerb, \sthreerc\}$.
The two-dimensional representation $E$ is given by the matrices:
$$
\begin{split}
D_{E}(e) &= \begin{pmatrix}
1 & 0\\
0 & 1
\end{pmatrix},\quad
D_{E}(\sthreer) = \begin{pmatrix}
c & -s\\
s & c
\end{pmatrix},
\quad
D_{E}(\sthreerr) = \begin{pmatrix}
c & s\\
-s & c
\end{pmatrix},\\
D_{E}(\sthreera) &= \begin{pmatrix}
1 & 0\\
0 & -1
\end{pmatrix},\quad
D_{E}(\sthreerb) = \begin{pmatrix}
c & -s\\
-s & -c
\end{pmatrix},\quad
D_{E}(\sthreerc) = \begin{pmatrix}
c & s\\
s & -c
\end{pmatrix}.
\end{split}
\end{equation}
Here, $c=\cos(2\pi/3)=-1/2$, $s=\sin(2\pi/3)=\sqrt{3}/2$.
The tensor product of representations can be taken, and it decomposes into a direct sum. For example, 
$\rho_E \otimes \rho_E = A_1 \oplus A_2 \oplus E$.
Table \ref{table:S3 representation} summarizes the decomposition of the tensor product of representations.


\begin{align}
T_1& = e\\
T_2 &= \sthreera+\sthreerb+\sthreerc,\\
T_3 &= \sthreer+\sthreerr.
\end{align}


\begin{align}
D_E(T_1) &= I_2\\
D_E(T_2) &= 0,\\
D_E(T_3) &= -I_2.
\end{align}


\begin{align}
D_{A_1}(T_1) = 1\\
D_{A_1}(T_2) = 3,\\
D_{A_1}(T_3) = 2.
\end{align}

\begin{align}
D_{A_2}(T_1) &= 1\\
D_{A_2}(T_2) &= -3,\\
D_{A_2}(T_3) &= 2.
\end{align}
